results.name: Antidiagonals of square array in which k-th row (k>0) is an arithmetic progression of difference 2^(k-1).
reference: G. H. Hardy, A Theorem Concerning the Infinite Cardinal Numbers, Quart. J. Math., 35 (1904), p. 90 = Collected Papers, Vol. VII, p. 430.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
formula: A(m,n) = 1 + n*2^(m-1) for m > 1. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 07 2020
As a triangle, T(n,k) = A(k,n-k) = 1 + (n-k)*2^(k-1). - _Gus Wiseman_, May 08 2021
program: { for(m=0, 10, for(n=0, 10, print1(A(m,n), ", ")); print) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 07 2020
xref: Diagonal n = m + 1 of the array is A002064.
Diagonal n = m of the array is A005183.
Column m = 1 of the array is A094373.
Diagonal n = m - 1 of the array is A131056.
A002109 gives hyperfactorials (sigma: A260146, omega: A303281).
